page.title: 05ECOLOGY PUBLIC ACCESS
page.content:
AREA SOUTH OF WESTWOODSIDE
THE OWNERS OF LANGHOLME FARM BOUGHT PART OF THE OLD MISSON TO HAXEY RAILWAY LINE, KWHICH RUNS THROUGH THE PROPERTY. THEY HAVE TAKEN UP THE RAIL TRACKS MAKING IT A CONVENIENT ROADWAY FOR TRACTORS AND MACHINERY, ALSO AN ATTRACTIVE COUNTRY WALK. A PUBLIC FOOTPATH FROM LANGHOLME TO WESTWOODSIDE JAS BEEN REDIRECTED AND IS NOW LSHOWN ON A DEFINITIVE MAP. IT USED TO RUN ALONG THE RAILWAY LINE BUT NOW SKIRTS THE PROPERTY. RAMLBERS HAVE BEEN KNOW TO USE THE JPATH ONLY LONCE ACCORDING TO THE OWNER. THERE ARE SEVERAL OTHER PUBLIC FOOTPATHS DISTRIBUTED THROUGHOUT THE REGION, ALL OF LWHICH ARE WELL USED.
